intro: Cynoglossum minutiflorum, commonly known as the lesser mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, pale blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and has hairy, oval-shaped leaves. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. Cynoglossum minutiflorum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in herbal medicine.
